thread.title: Kansas Politician Adamant That 6,000 People Committed Voter Fraud in New Hampshire
thread.title_full: Kansas Politician Adamant That 6,000 People Committed Voter Fraud in New Hampshire

author: Harris
title: Kansas Politician Adamant That 6,000 People Committed Voter Fraud in New Hampshire
text:
Trump Doesn’t Care About Being Called Racist by His “Haters” 
This issue of busing voters into the state is reportedly “widely known,” according to White House senior policy adviser Stephen Miller, who said, “‘Having worked before on a campaign in New Hampshire … It’s very real. It’s very serious.” 
While Kobach admitted that some of those cases were legitimate, as in people who moved to New Hampshire from other states before Election Day , he insisted that some of those voters voted illegally in more than one state. 
“We do know that a lot of people did that, and we will have data at the end of the month,” he said.   
Check out the interview. And if anyone ever doubted CNN’s liberal bias, Bolduan’s pretense of journalism will dispel it here: 
Though CNN, being the “news” outlet it is, could not wait for the evidence and instead decided to put out claims that slammed Kobach’s statements. Kobach responded via Twitter and maintains that more evidence will come shortly. This image shows proof of @CNN bias. They run text below my picture claiming my statements are false. So much for letting the viewer decide. pic.twitter.com/vXslvF7oKk 
— Kris W. Kobach (@KrisKobach1787) February 13, 2017
